DOC.brief_summary: Background : The study aim compare efficacy dexmedetomidine versus midazolam sedation early postoperative period child underwent scoliosis surgery . Methods : We perform prospective , randomized trial intensive care unit ( ICU ) tertiary care center . In study , 42 patient ( American Society Anesthesiology physical status I II ) underwent scoliosis surgery divide 2 group accord sedation protocol : group DEX ( n = 22 ) group MDZ ( n = 20 ) . Children ( 12-18 year ) require mechanical ventilation underwent continuous infusion either dexmedetomidine ( group DEX ; start dose , 0.4 μg•kg-1•h-1 ) midazolam ( group MDZ ; start dose , 0.1 mg•kg-1•h-1 ) intermittent fentanyl , need . The efficacy sedation assess use Richmond Agitation Sedation Scale ( RASS ) . Quality pain relief measure use Numeric Visual Analog Scale ( NVAS ) . During arousal assessment , delirium determine patient RASS range -2 +1 use Confusion Assessment Method ICU ( CAM-ICU ) . Fentanyl consumption , incidence delirium , NVAS score , hemodynamics record postoperatively 2 , 4 , 6 , 24 h ICU .
